ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned so much in Professor Dimitrova's lab - various lab techniques, how to analyze and write scientifically, how to use specific instruments, it was all interesting and a great learning experience.

I gained many skills and insights as a result of taking this course. Due to the independent nature of this course, I learned what it takes to pull together an independent research project, stay on track, write a cohesive paper that summarizes a semester worth of work, and present such work. Technically, I learned how to perform PCR, gel electrophoresis, and gibson assembly laboratory methods.

I had the chance to do research over the course of the semester as a part of my classwork. I learned valuable laboratory skills, including lab techniques, how to pose a scientific question, and how to interpret scientific data.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The strength is the amount of independence it gives the students enrolled - we simply propose our project and write a summary at the end, so we do not have to stress about any assignments in between and instead can just focus on the lab itself. This is really great.

I do not think there any any weaknesses of this course. It is highly independent, so it is a challenge to find a general response to this question, but the independence granted to the experimenter is a true strength. Perhaps there could be a colloquium at the end of all people working on independent projects so that they could present their works or just discuss them over dinner.
Strengths: I like the proposal and final report--great way to organize our thoughts and plans for the project.
Not entirely sure the 15 page paper at the end of the semester is necessary.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: DEFINITELY! If you are interested in a flexible, self-directed research experience, take this course.
Be prepared to work in the lab a lot, and the 15 page paper will take you longer than you think it will.
